Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Police nab one for break-in, recover goo.description: AURANGABAD: A history-sheeter was nabbed by the local crime branch (LCB) of Aurangabad rural police in connection with a house break-in case committed in Vaijapur tehsil on Thursday. In the latest case, the accused — identified as Kishor Wayal (38) — along with his accomplice stole articles worth Rs24 lakh, including 720 gram of gold, 795 gram of silver and some cash. The accused is a self-proclaimed “Robin Hood” and is known for using the stolen money for social activities in his village Mera of Chikhli in Buldhana district. LCB inspector Bhagwat Phunde said, “As per our information, the accused has over 100 cases of house break-in and thefts registered against him in different parts of the country.” Police claimed that they have not only detected the latest case, but have also made cent per cent recovery. A manhunt has been launched for Wayal’s accomplice who is on the run. Wayal along with his accomplice on Thursday broke into the house of a trader, Hrushabh Chajed, who along with his family had gone to Pune. The incident came to light at 5pm, when a neighbour went to Chajed’s house for getting a mixer. She soon informed others and police was called in. During probe, the LCB team found a CCTV footage in which two suspects were found moving on a motorbike. The police soon identified one of the suspects as Wayal, who after committing the offence went straight to his hometown. A police team was sent Wayal’s village to arrest him. During interrogation, the accused not only confessed to the crime but also handed over the stolen articles to police. Wayal recently got released from prison after he was arrested by city police for committing burglary in a similar fashion on February 4. Additional superintendent of police Ganesh Gawde said that the Wayal’s involvement in other property offences committed since he got released is being checked. “We suspect his involvement in more property offences and we are investigating the cases,” he said. \nChitrakala Mahotsav held at Saraswati.description: The Chitrakala Mahotsav held recently at Saraswati Bhuvan College attracted many art lovers in the city.  The event witnessed a presence of personalities from various fields. Sanjay Kumar, commissioner of police who attended the fest along with wife Roshita said, “Sketching is one of the most expressive forms of art. With so much talent around, educational institutes in the city should ensure that every art aspirant is provided with good facilities.” Around 300 students participated in the Mahotsav. Over 100 works of art that were woven around the theme —India, were exhibited by the students. Dr Ashok Bhalerao, Shital Shahane, Dattatray Bairagi, Samir Kulkarni, Sanjay Pardeshi and Ravindra Toravane were present on the occasion. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Celebrating Vat Poornima through banyan.description: Aurangabad Municipal Corporation recently took a step towards green city as they distributed banyan saplings to ladies working at the premises. Ahead of Vat Savitri Poornima, the saplings were distributed to mark the day. Married ladies in the Hindu community celebrate the day in honour of their husbands. Dressed in traditional attires, women observe a day-long fast, tying thread around a banyan tree. Therefore, the ladies were given these saplings. They also posed for a picture as they got them. Crime branch nab 2, seizes Gutkha worth.description: AURANGABAD: The crime branch of the city police on Saturday nabbed two accused and raided one of their houses, from where Gutkha worth Rs 7 lakh was seized. The arrested accused have been identified as Syed Riyaz (27) of Khokadpura in Paithan Gate area and Syed Zafar (30) of Misbah Colony in Padegaon area. Crime branch inspector Madhukar Sawant said that the accused have been arrested after the team found out that vehicles carrying Gutkha worth lakhs of rupees was delivering a portion to a suspect in Padegaon area. The team raided their house after zeroing in on the vehicles. Accordingly, sub inspector Tushar Deore raided the house of the suspect on Saturday and nabbed Syed Zafar, seizing Gutkha worth Rs 7 lakh. Three days ago, in a joint operation carried out by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the city police’s crime branch, two vehicles were seized when banned gutkha was being unloaded on Nagpur-Mumbai highway. A total of 243 bags worth Rs 38 lakh, along with the two vehicles, including a pick-up van and a mini truck, were seized. Sources said that with the allegations going around about turning a blind eye to illicit businesses in the city, the authorities have launched an all-out drive against illicit Gutkha trading in the city and have already seized a huge quantity of Gutkha in the multiple raids carried out in the past one month. Women told about traffic rules on Vat Po.description: AURANGABAD: Cashing in on the opportunity of thousands of women visiting Waluj police station for worshipping the banyan tree in its premises on the occasion of Vat Poornima, police ran an awareness campaign on Sunday where they explained to the women how following traffic rules would ensure their husband’s long life. Waluj police station is the only police station in the city with a banyan tree in its premises. Each year, thousands of women from the locality visit the police station on this day to perform rituals at the banyan tree. Organising the awareness campaign on a religious occasion was the brainchild of inspector of Waluj police station Sandeep Gurme. The inspector told TOI, “Several kilometres of the Aurangabad-Pune highway passes through our jurisdiction. We see many accidents which happen due to petty mistakes or for not following traffic norms. Our aim at running the awareness campaign was to make the women realise that merely worshipping the banyan tree for the long life of their husbands would not help, following traffic norms would.” A group of woman constables headed by a woman sub-inspector were deployed for the awareness session. Each women visiting the station was given handbills, with an instruction to paste them at the entrance of their houses. Till evening, around 8,000 handbills were reportedly distributed. Women were briefed on key reasons for accidents like consumption of alcohol, driving beyond the permissible limit, playing loud music while driving, lack of sleep before taking long drives, competing with other vehicles on the road, etc. They were also suggested to press upon the male members of their families than unless necessary, they should avoid travelling at night. Commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad said that the initiative was a part of the police’s awareness campaign on traffic rules. “Apart from professional responsibility, the number of people losing lives is painful at the personal front too. We are running these campaigns with an aim to bring down the number of fatal accidents on the roads.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

With 16mm rainfall, region\u2019s defici.description: AURANGABAD: The delayed arrival of monsoon coupled with inadequate pre-monsoon showers has resulted in rainfall deficit of 79.2% in Marathwada by the end of first-half of June. The region, comprising eight districts, has received an average of only 16mm rainfall — accounting for only a little over 2% of average its annual rainfall received from June to October. The overall monsoon deficiency in Marathwada is more than double as compared to country’s rainfall deficiency that stands at an average 43%. As per official data, Nanded district has received the lowest 6% of the expected showers since June 1, followed by Aurangabad (8%), Jalna (12%), Hingoli (16%) and Beed (21%). Remaining three districts from the region have reported over 30% of the expected rainfall during the current rainy season, offering some respite to the drought-hit areas. Latur district has recorded the highest 39% of the expected rainfall so far followed by Parbhani (36%) and Osmanabad (30%). In its monsoon-related bulletin, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that conditions were becoming favourable for further advancement of the southwest monsoon to more parts of central Arabian Sea, Karnataka and remaining parts of Tamil Nadu. “In a regular course of action, the southwest monsoon should have reached central India by now, but it is yet to reach Maharashtra. The monsoon has been lingering over the southern peninsula and other areas with only coastal parts of Karnataka and Kerala received monsoon-related rain so far,” the IMD said. As per Met forecast, monsoon is likely to become active again once cyclone Vayu crosses the Gujarat coast by Monday evening. Shriniwas Aundhkar, director of city-based APJ Abdul Kalam Centre for Astronomy and Research, said south-east Maharashtra that includes parts of Marathwada such as Latur and Nanded district can expect arrival of Monsoon by June 20-21. “Besides the fact that progress of monsoon was somewhat halted due to cyclone Vayu, it was observed that no strong weather conditions were formed for the formation and onset of the southwest monsoon this year since the beginning. Let us hope that no more major hurdles come in the path of the onset of monsoon,” he said. The farming community is among many who have been eagerly awaiting the arrival of monsoon. Ashok Mane, a farmer from Tadsonna village in Beed district, said it was nerve-wrecking to wait for the monsoon even after the first half of June is over. “We received pre-Monsoon showers, but those were inadequate to undertake the sowing activity during Kharif season. The drought has broken the backbone of the farming community and the extended delay is very agonizing,” he said. Meanwhile, sporadic showers were reported in parts of the city with nearly 10mm rainfall getting recorded till 6.30pm on Monday. As per IMD, Aurangabad is likely to witness cloudy skies for the next few days with no chance of major rainfall. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra GST department to act on sal.description: AURANGABAD: The state good and service tax office has decided to undertake intensive inspection to keep a check on sale of bogus fertilizers in Aurangabad which causes a loss to the tax department. In a letter dated June 4 sent to the agriculture director and joint commissioner of GST Bhavan, secretary MNS Paithan Taluka Vilas Jagdale and Aurangabad district chief Vijay Chavan had complained to both departments about the sale of bogus seeds and fertilizers directly responsible for farmer suicides. Referring to the action taken by agriculture department in Gangapur Taluka against marketing of bogus fertilizer worth Rs 3.5 lakh, the party unit stated that such practices cause financial losses to the farmers which leads them to the extreme step of ending their life. While the seeds are tax free, a GST of 5% is charged on fertilisers. Jagdale, a homeopathic doctor and a farmer himself, said that the crop loss cannot solely be credited to water scarcity. “For example, cotton is a crop for regions with dry weather. The crop yields better in drier areas than in water sufficient areas. However, it is due to the poor quality of seeds and fertilizer which causes huge losses to cotton farmers,” he said. The MNS activists met with the state GST officials and informed them about the problem. Speaking to TOI, Santosh Shriwastav, deputy commissioner, state GST, confirmed that the department will hold confidential enquiry to find out about the sale of products without the payment of GST. “I have forwarded the matter to joint commissioner, state tax Aurangabad division. Subsequently, our inspectors will verify the books of accounts of the seed and fertilizer dealers and impose penalty if tax evasion is found,” Shriwastav said. The penalty would include tax collection under the jurisdiction of Aurangabad division state GST office which has districts like Aurangabad, Jalna and Beed districts under them. BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Fashionistas of Aurangabad walk the ramp.description: The stage at Yashwantrao Chavan Natyagruha in Aurangabad saw fashion buffs in the city come under one roof for the Mr and Mrs Fashion Icon pageant in Aurangabad. Around 24 participants took part in the competition wherein they showcased their various talents for the show. The contestants put forth their singing, dancing and acting skills to impress the judges. On the basis of talent round, question and answer round along with ramp walk, the contestants were finalised as to who will be the winner. A special round on the theme of brides and grooms of India saw models shine the ramp with the attires. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

ADG inspection concludes.description: AURANGABAD: The annual inspection of Aurangabad city police concluded on Saturday, with additional director general of police (special operations) Rajender Singh asking city police to mend its ways in handling of the overall affairs. Singh, who has served as Aurangabad commissioner of police, was impressed with the initiatives, including skill development, employment generation carried out under community policing. He appreciated the efforts made to bridge the gap between communities initiated by incumbent city police chief Chiranjeev Prasad. Singh also applauded the city police chief for successfully ensuring peaceful passage of general elections and winning trust of the deprived sections of the society through various confidence building programmes. During the inspection, the senior officer paid visit to some police stations, apart from reviewing the statistics of the total number of offences registered, detected, undetected, preventive measures, number of property as well as body offences, actions taken against active criminals, execution of summons, conviction rate and performance of each of the branches including special branch, crime branch, economic offences wing, and directed for initiating some corrective measures. ADG Singh, on the second day of inspection on Saturday, held a marathon crime review meeting with all the senior officers including the police stations chiefs. In the second half of the day, Singh summoned all the police station chiefs as well inspectors heading all the other branches, in person and reviewed their work. He chided some of the police station chiefs of some prime police stations for failing to deliver on the expected lines. The officer also pulled up the inspector rank officers for poor detection rate in terms of two-wheeler thefts, nabbing of fled accused, and other property offences. ADG Singh also noticed the sudden fall in the recording of offences like mobile and other petty thefts in majority of the police stations. He asked the police station chiefs to personally ensure registration of offences, and pay attention to every happening in their respective jurisdictions, especially in terms of crime against women, children. The officer also reviewed city’s overall scenario in terms communal harmony, vigilance on those fuelling communal tensions, illicit businesses, if any, and as well as the preparations for the assembly elections scheduled for few months from now. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Aurangabad: Valuables worth Rs 2.10 lakh.description: AURANGABAD: A woman's purse containing Rs 1.10 lakh in cash, along with gold jewellery and a mobile phone, total worth Rs 2.10 lakh was stolen from a marriage hall off Jalna Road at Chikalthana around 2pm on Saturday. Sunita Satish Chavan (49), a resident of Spandannagar, N-4 Cidco, told the MIDC Cidco police that she had been to Bhagyalaxmi Lawns for attending a marriage ceremony of her close relative on Saturday. At a time when she and other relatives were busy with the preparation for the rituals, she kept her purse on an empty chair beside her. After a while she found it to be missing. The incident occurred around 2pm, when the marriage hall was full of relatives and guests. Unable to find the purse, she reached out to the police and lodged a complaint, following which a theft case was registered. The police said they retrieved the CCTV footage and found that two unidentified teenagers, even unknown to the family were roaming around and picked the purse. They said that they have launched a manhunt for the suspects. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Now, State Haj Committee to start Umrah.description: Aurangabad: Maharashtra Haj committee, which on behalf of the state has been traditionally providing pilgrimage services to Muslims visiting holy cities of Mecca and Madina, will soon also be starting Umrah services. The announcement was made during the committee chairman Jamal Siddiqui’s visit to Aurangabad on Sunday. He was touring the city and adjoining areas to review preparations for the pilgrimage scheduled for August this year. “After fulfilling the Haj-related responsibility, we will start affordable Umrah services for the pilgrims from the state,” he said This year India’s Haj quota has been increased by 25,000, taking the total number of pilgrims from India to 2 lakh, out of which 1.4 lakh go through the Haj committee, while the remaining through different private tour operators (PTOs). While in the case of Umrah, all the pilgrims are sent through PTOs. According to those who are in this business, more pilgrims go on Umrah than on Haj each year. Haj is one of the five pillars of Islam, in which the rituals are performed over five days in and around Mecca. Compared to this, Umrah, which is termed as mini pilgrimage, is optional and can be performed any time throughout the year. Usually, Umrah tours range from five to 40 days. During the Haj season, the pilgrims who want to perform only Umrah are not allowed. Haj Committee of India was formed in the 2002 through a central parliamentary Act. In this Act there is a provision formation of subsequent Haj committees in each state for assisting the central committee. The basic responsibilities of the state Haj committees include collecting forms, training pilgrims, providing facilities at embarkation points, coordination with the central Haj committee and so on. The authorities maintained that even if the state decides to start Umrah services, it will have to wait for the amendment in the Act. Incumbent CEO of the state Haj committee Maqsood Khan told TOI, “In the present Act, there is no provision of sending pilgrims to Umrah. Though in the revised policy, which was published 2018, it was intended to start Umrah services, but it did not materialise as there is no provision about it in the Act.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MIM corporators create ruckus during GB.description: AURANGABAD: The general body meeting of the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) on Thursday witnessed uproar and unruly behavior from MIM corporators after their plea to greet newly-elected Member of Parliament from Aurangabad, Imtiyaz Jaleel, was ignored by mayor Nandkumar Ghodele. The MIM corporators raised slogans against the mayor and created ruckus during the meeting. They also tried to snatch away the mace of the mayor. Following this, six MIM corporators were suspended for a day by the mayor. Subsequently, Sena-BJP, Congress and NCP joined hands to condemn the behavior of MIM members and insisted the mayor to pass a resolution to disqualify all the 20 MIM corporators present at the meeting. Following this, the mayor directed the municipal administration to prepare a proposal that will be sent to the state government, seeking its nod to disqualify the unruly corporators. The mayor also asked the civic administration to suspend and inquire the conduct of civic body’s security officer Baburao Jadhav for not handling the situation properly even after being ordered to do so. Ghodele has asked the administration to ensure that 10 ex-servicemen hired by the civic body be posted at every general body meeting to tackle any such eventuality in the future. He also asked the administration to appoint women security guards. It all began with BJP members suggesting that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should be greeted for coming back to power for the second consecutive term. To this, Ghodele announced that he approves the proposal to greet Modi as well as all the newly-elected Members of Parliament. After a while, the MIM members entered the meeting hall and opposition leader Sarita Borde led by 19 other corporators raised the issue of passing a proposal to greet Jaleel. However, mayor ignored this demand saying that he has already approved a proposal greeting all the newly-elected MPs and no specific proposal could be passed. However, the MIM corporators insisted the mayor to consider their resolution. When mayor continued to ignore their demand, the corporators raised slogans against him and tried to snatch away the mace. He then suspended six of the MIM members for a day while asking them to go away. However, other MIM corporators rushed to the rescue of their colleagues and staged a sit-in in front of the podium. In the meantime, Congress corporator Afsar Khan strongly opposed the resolution alleging that MIM MP didn’t deserve such a greeting. The mayor then called the police in. Since arrests cannot be made in the hall, the policemen lifted MIM corporator one by one and took them out of the meeting hall. They also faced difficulty in removing the women members. However, with the help of police women they too were removed from the hall. Water issue raisedAfter the MIM corporators were removed from the meeting hall, the BJP took the administration to task for its failure in tackling the drinking water issue. BJP corporator Nitin Chittee virtually prostrated before the civic officials to draw the administration and mayor’s attentions towards the acute water shortage faced by the residents. Madhuri Advant, another BJP corporator, threatened the administration of launching a ‘jail bharo’ agitation. She said that when she staged demonstration outside the water reservoir, the administration lodged police complaints against the agitators. Advant, who is also a lawyer, said several wards were getting water supply after a gap of nine to 10 days, still the administration or the officials concerned failed to act properly. The mayor then asked the municipal commissioner Nipun Vinayak to explain the situation who said the situation would be under control in a matter of four days. The mayor subsequently announced that a special general body meeting would he held after four days to discuss water scarcity issue specifically. Crime branch nabs gang of cattle thieves.description: AURANGABAD: The local crime branch of Aurangabad rural police busted a state-level gang of cattle thieves and claimed to have detected several cattle theft cases registered in and around Aurangabad district in the past few months. The accused have been identified as Balu alias Somnath Umaji Mali (31), Dnyaneshwar alias Mauli Shravan Mali (24), Avinash alias Avi Phoolsitaram Jadhav (40), Sopan alias Gotya Ashok Dhangar (30), Arjun Kurde and Ramesh Mali. As per preliminary report, the accused were involved in stealing cattle from Ladgaon, Ranjangaon in Phulmabri, Bokudjalgaon of Paithan of Aurangabad and several other places in Beed, Jalna and others parts of the state. Aurangabad superintendent of police Mokshada Patil said that considering the rise in number of cattle theft complaints reaching police stations, the local crime branch was assigned the job to personally look into the matter and resolve the issue on priority. “During drought situation, the farmers are already under tremendous stress and their cattle being stolen was just adding to their woes,” Patil said. Local crime branch officer Bhagwat Phunde said, “We are confident of cracking many cases of cattle theft committed by this gang.” According to police, the accused used to sell the stolen cattle to butchers in different parts of the state and attempts are being made to identify the suspects who have reportedly bought stolen cattle from this gang. An officer privy to the investigation said that after the busting of this gang, police from different police units have sought details of the accused and are willing to take them in custody for detecting several cattle theft cases registered in their respective jurisdictions. Police also did not rule out the possibility of many farmers failing to register a case of their cattle being stolen. Farmer activist Jayajirao Suryawanshi said, “As a solution to non-reported incidents, the police station chiefs should be asked to check for non-reported incidents of cattle thefts in their respective jurisdictions and register offences accordingly.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Schedule released, admissions to Class X.description: Aurangabad: The schedule of the Centralised Admission Process (CAP) for Class XI in junior colleges in the city has been released by the state education department, with the filling of part II of the form, which involves students sharing the options of preferred colleges, beginning Wednesday. Over 110 junior colleges will be part of the CAP for admission to different knowledge streams including Arts, Commerce and Science streams as well as Bifocal subject and Higher Secondary Vocational Courses (HSVC). Also, in a first-of-its-kind measure, the office of the deputy director of education, Aurangabad has decided to form flying squads to keep a check on rural colleges admitting students more than their total intake capacity. “Students can collect the information booklet from their respective schools, from where they have collected their SSC certificate. Those from outside Maharashtra or those belonging to other educational boards such as CBSE or ICSE, can collect the booklet from the nearest guidance centre. Students and their parents or guardians are advised to read the booklet carefully and follow the necessary procedure exactly,” said CAP authorities. The official schedule or related updates about the admission process are available on https://aurangabad.11thadmission.net. The CAP will begin with zero round and admission to the bifocal courses and HSVC stream will be given through it first. After the zero round, the vacant seats of bifocal subjects will be filled in as per the merit of the student through regular rounds and it will be uploaded on the above mentioned website.As already announced earlier, the CAP will have only three regular rounds after the zero round and allotment will be done as per merit, reservation and the preferences given by the students. Students who do not get admission in the zero round, can participate in the regular rounds.After the three regular rounds, a special round will be arranged and the students who have still not got admission in the previous rounds and those who are restricted in the earlier rounds, can participate in this round.After the special round, as per the principle of first-come first-served, another round will be arranged for the benefit of the students who have cancelled their admission in earlier rounds or those who are restricted in the earlier rounds or who have not got admission anywhere, it was said.On keeping a check on colleges from the fringe and rural areas, CAP authorities said that the admission for Class XII in these colleges have to be in proportion with the intake capacity of their Class XI. “A section of students who are academically weak tend to opt for colleges from rural areas which are notorious for unethical practices in terms of manipulation of attendance or malpractices during the examination. The flying squads will keep a vigil on these colleges during the Class XI admissions,” said CAP authorities. The centralized online admission process for Class XI is being carried out in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) in Mumbai, Thane and Raigad districts, Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation areas along with Nagpur, Amravati, Nashik and Aurangabad municipal corporations.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. \nVasantotsav-Nritya Aaradhana-2013, ada.description: The dance department of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University recently hosted a dance concert. Titled Vasantotsav-Nritya Aaradhana-2013, this concert welcomed the spring season and was a treat for dance enthusiasts in the city. A special performance with ‘Save Water’ as its theme beautifully conveyed a message to the audience. There was something for everyone — right from a Bharatnatyam performance titled Pushpanjali to a Rajasthani folk dance as well as a fusion act of lavani and western dance styles. Those spotted at the event included P Medini Hombal, lecturer at Indira Kala Sangit Vishwavidyalaya, Prafulla Mirajgaonkar, Dilip Yardi, and V Soumyasri, assistant professor, department of dance, Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nJackky Bhagnani promotes his upcoming.description: Bollywood actor Jackky Bhagnani was in town recently to promote his upcoming film 'Rangrezz'. During the event, the actor broke into an impromptu jig with the song Nand Ke Lala from the film. He also invited his fans on stage who were thrilled to to shake a leg with the actor.  Talking about his character Jackky said, “I play a middle class Maharashtrian boy from Lalbaug who puts his family and friends before everything else. I hope people like the film and my character.” Talking about the city he added, “I always wanted to come here. The city has good heritage value and people here are very warm.”' Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Aurangabad range IG for bridging gap wit.description: AURANGABAD: Aurangabad range special inspector general of police (IGP) Ravinder Kumar Singal will soon launch a dedicated WhatsApp number for people living in remote areas to forward their complaints and grievances directly to him. Recently, an elderly farmer from a remote village bordering Karnataka border reached Aurangabad after travelled over 300-km to meet Aurangabad range special inspector general of police Ravinder Kumar Singal as local authorities did not pay any heed to his complaint. Considering the distance the farmer had to travel, the money he spent on bus fare, spent several hours in travelling and lost his day’s earning, for meeting the IGP for a few minutes, did not appear rational to the incumbent IGP has now pledged to provide relief to such complainants. The special IGP has started working on a module by people them to lodge complaint through video messages apart from sharing photos of their written complaints, directly to him. Aurangabad range included Aurangabad rural, Jalna, Beed and Osmanabad districts in its jurisdiction and those who fail to get justice in their respective districts, are forced to travel all the way to Aurangabad with their grievance before Singal. “It is unfortunate that a poor man who fails to get justice from the local police station as well as the senior officers including superintendent of police is forced to travel around 300-km for talking to me for few minutes,” Singal said. The officer has started working on different modules including using a dedicated WhatsApp number for receiving the video of the complainant as well as photographs of the written complaints lodged with local authorities. The complainants would be requested to reach out to the IGP only incase when the local authorities fail to respond to their complaints and address their issues. The team at IGP office believes that the penetration of WhatsApp is in almost every possible remote corner and should be used instead of introducing another application. “We have an option of developing a dedicated mobile-based application for the purpose, but again we do not want our new application to meet the fate of several other applications that did not last long in service as well as public memory,” an officer said. Singal echoed similar views and maintained that soon drives will be initiated to publicise the dedicated number. “Instead of asking any of the subordinate to handle the helpline number, I intend to personally keep this dedicated number with me so that our response time is not only brought down, but also I am connected with the last man in my jurisdiction,” he said. Father\u2019s day: 22-year-old woman don.description: AURANGABAD: Twenty two-year-old Ankita Jadhav, a Nanded resident, donated a portion of her liver to give a new lease of life to her father Sanjay Jadhav, who is suffering from a liver ailment. Both the donor and the recipient are recovering well, doctors said. 52-year-old Sanjay, assistance commissioner in Nanded Waghala Municipal Corporation, was diagnosed with hepatitis-B by a hospital in Nanded in October. On the medical advice of Gopal Rathi, he was referred to Asian Hospital in Hyderabad. According to Rathi, 80% of Sanjay’s liver was damaged. Sanjay was discharged from the Asian Hospital after initial treatment. However, he started suffering from health issues again in January and this time he was admitted to Global Hospital, Hyderabad. Dharmesh Kapur of Global Hospital conducted an investigations that confirmed that his liver had been completely damaged because of hepatitis-B. The disease had also caused forgetfulness and weakness. “We were told we have to get a cadaver liver transplant, but in the organ recipient’s waiting list, my father was fiftieth. The doctors said we can’t wait for that long,” Ankita said. The doctors then considered the option of living donor liver transplantation. Subsequently, the possible donors were explored. “For living organ donation, only brothers, sisters, parents or children are considered. In my family, my uncle and I were found to have a matching blood group with my father. As my uncle is a diabetes patient, only I could donate,” the daughter said. Ankita’s blood group is O positive and her father’s O negative. Ankita, a student of second year MCA, did not think twice and decided to go ahead with the donation. The transplant procedure was carried out on June 10, in which 650 gram of liver tissues from Ankita were grafted to her father’s liver. Fortunately, Sanjay’s body adjusted well to the new tissues and he is currently recovering. Ankita will be discharged from the hospital on Monday and Sanjay will be under care for 21 days, after which he has been advised to take bed rest for one-and-a-half months. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

38 power theft cases detected in Latur.description: Aurangabad: The newly-installed electric meters, comprising radio frequency (RF) and infra-red (IR), have helped the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) in detecting as many as 38 power theft cases without deploying any manpower on the field in Latur.Dhananjay Pawar, MSEDCL public relations officer for Nanded zone, said these special high-tech meters are installed in areas that are prone to the power theft.“The newly-installed meters and overall system have special data concentrator unit technology among other features that provides real-time update about power consumption of every consumer after an interval of 15 minutes. Thus, the advanced devices help the central server to immediately detect any significant deviation in power consumption and thus detect any attempt of power theft,” he said.Power thefts amounting to Rs2.37 lakh were reported in Latur during April and May and necessary criminal proceedings have been initiated against offenders.Among other benefits of the newly-installed meters, these devices help the state power utility in generating accurate monthly bills. “The meters and its server operate with minimal human interface which makes the entire system impeccable and accountable. The new devices are best considering the interest of consumers as well as that of the MSEDCL,” Patil said.Nanded, Latur and Jalgaon are among MSEDCL zones that are notorious for power thefts and the state power utility has set a target of installing over 8.5 lakh new electric meters having the RF and IR technology here.Among different cities, Latur has a target of installation of such 88,338 meters of which 62,265 have been put into place by replacing the old devices.Aurangabad division of MSEDCL, comprising Aurangabad, Latur, Nanded and Jalgaon zones, had caught as many as 19,844 cases of power thefts during the last fiscal, recovering fine worth Rs6.02 crore. Aurangabad zone reported the maximum 9,668 cases of power theft followed by Jalgaon (5,044), Latur (3,512) and Nanded (1,620).As per section 126 of the Electricity Act, 2003, in case of detection of ‘Unauthorized Use of Energy (UUE), the tariff equal to twice the tariff applicable for the relevant category is recovered if the MSEDCL authorities reach to the conclusion that unauthorised use of electricity has taken place. Also, section 135 of the Act stipulates for initiating police action among other stern actions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Machine brought for cleaning nullah brea.description: AURANGABAD: The Aurangabad Municipal Corporation's attempts to use an excavator for pre-monsoon cleaning of Baroodgar Nala have ended up damaging an important section of protection wall along the nullah. The damage, residents said, could now increase the risk of flooding in nearby areas as the monsoon gains in intensity. The AMC was supposed to have completed a major part of the nullah cleaning before the rains, but even until last week, the civic body had not hired machines for the job. Finally, after much wait, residents living near the Baroodgar Nala were relieved to see the excavator - on AMC duty - turn up for the cleaning job. According to Syed Tauseef Ali, a Buddi Lane resident, the nullah has not been cleaned in a long time. “Its water has reached the surface of the bridge running over it due to indiscriminate dumping of waste,” Tauseef said. The wall was damaged a day after the machine went to work. Neha Sadaf, a resident of Kabadipura, said the 30-foot-long, five-foot high section at the curve of the nullah was built to keep the water from flowing out. "Now, we fear 30 minutes of rain will be enough to cause the drain to overflow and flood nearby homes." The AMC had decided to hire machines and engage its own staff for the cleaning of all major nullahs in city - to be carried out under the supervision of ward engineers. The machine was abandoned by AMC staff after the wall was damaged. Sakharam Panzade, city engineer, said the wall was damaged when the machine was being lowered into the nullah. “We will rebuild the protection wall,” Panzade said.
