Jump rope can help excel in other sports.description: AURANGABAD: A fairly new sport, jump rope, has achieved international acclaim in a little time. Coaches and players say that the game helps one to develop stamina, coordination and concentration which aids in practicing other sports and improves studies. After the recent success of local athletes in the sport at international level, the stakeholders hope that the interest for the game will grow. In the 6th South Asian Jump Rope Championship organised by Bhutan Jump Rope Association from May 27 to 30 in Thimpu Bhutan, Harsheesh Singh Dhingra won two gold medals in under-16 category while Vyankatesh Udawant, Harsh Takwale, Ghanshyam Bhagwatkar, Vedant Wahatule and Vishal Mhaske from the city won two gold medals each in Under-17 category. The students were selected for the international squad considering their performance in the last one year in the state-level jump rope competitions. Certified jump rope coach Abhishek Narwade said that the sport has gained attention from 2006 when the Maharashtra Jump Rope Association came into existence. "Apart from the achievements one can get in the jump rope events, playing the sport helps to build a base for all other outdoor sports. Jump rope helps improve stamina, coordination, breathing control and improves concentration in studies," Narwade said. Harsheesh Dhingra, one of the athletes from Delhi Public School Aurangabad, said that the sport has helped him improve his other interest i.e. swimming. Harsheesh has reached at national-level in swimming. Harsh Takwale, another jump rope athlete, said that he was introduced to jump rope as a professional sport three years ago and since then he has been constantly participating in various state and national championships. "Over the years, my energy levels are high and my academic scores have improved," Takwale said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MIM corporators protest against \u2018un.description: AURANGABAD: The MIM corporators staged a dharna in front of the AMC office on Monday morning, protesting against the alleged unnecessary spending by the city mayor on photos and videos. The corporators asked the mayor to display the photos and videos, for which he allegedly had spent Rs 20 lakh of people’s money. Mayor Nandkumar Ghodele refuted the allegations, calling them baseless. The public relations officer of the AMC said most of the money was spent on making video recordings of anti-encroachment drives and of solid waste management. On Saturday, based on the reply by the AMC’s accounts department to an RTI plea, Aurangabad MP Imtiyaz Jaleel said at a press conference that, from October 29, 2017 to December 31, 2018, Ghodele spent Rs 19.93 lakh on photos and videos. “The mayor has spent Rs 19.98 lakh on photographs and videos of his events, Rs 4.70 lakh on tea, Rs 1.11 lakh on garlands and shawls, Rs 10.42 lakh on renovation of an already renovated official bungalow and Rs 4.19 lakh on food and sound system during the general body meetings,” Jaleel had alleged. Jaleel said that at a time when the civic body did not have money to pay salary to its employees and contractors, the mayor spending money on unwanted things is uncalled for. “When the mayor can purchase a sound system for less than Rs 1 lakh, why is he spending so much money on renting it?” he asked. He pledged to dig out all documents from the civic body and bring all the scams to surface to ensure that the corrupt officials and corporators are put behind bars. On Monday, MIM corporators led by leader of opposition in AMC Sarita Borde, group leader Naser Siddique and district chief Shaikh camped outside the AMC office and raised slogans against the mayor. “We have asked the municipal commissioner to write to the chief minister about the gross misuse of public money by the mayor. If municipal commissioner doesn’t act we will go to the court against the mayor for violation of article 10 (1) of Bombay Provincial Municipal Corporations Act 1949,” Siddique said. Ghodele, however, said the allegations were baseless and were part of the MIM’s habit. “The claims made about expenditure of Rs 20 lakh on photos and videos show their lack of knowledge. Only Rs 1.21 lakh is spent on my photos which were taken when I was on official visits,” he said, adding that explanation of Rs 20 lakh expenditure will be given by the AMC’s public relations officer. On Sunday, Ghodele had said that he as a mayor has certain privileges and the post should not be dragged into politics. “I do not take the MP’s allegations seriously. Their party has a tendency to make allegations.” He said Jaleel should focus on development of the city rather than petty issues. “By bringing out such controversies, they are diverting us from development issues. I have commitment to the public and I will answer them about the money spent by me while holding the office.” The AMC’s PRO said, out of the Rs 19.93 lakh, Rs 4.95 lakh was spent on filming the actions taken by the anti-encroachment department as a proof in case of any legal complication, Rs 3.68 lakh was spent on coverage of welcome ceremonies, press conferences, anniversary celebrations and impromptu events, Rs 1.21 lakh was spent on photos and videos of mayor’s visits. Rs 10.85 lakh worth of photos and videos were shot about the garbage issue of the city. “At one time, local residents resisted dumping of waste in their area at 4am. Such incidents had to be videographed. We have all the data available,” the PRO said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tender rebidding scheduled for July 1.description: Aurangabad: After failing to find any contractor for its ambitious Bal Thackeray memorial project in the city, Shiva Sena leaders are hopeful that contractors will showing interest in the rebidding scheduled for July 1.Despite Sena being in power at the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) for almost three decades, the civic body could not find any contractor for the construction of the memorial. The tender has been floated three times, but in vain.When contacted, mayor Nandkumar Ghodele said, “The contractors raised certain queries and we have addressed them. The tender will go for rebidding on July 1 and we are confident that several contractors will come forward.”Sources informed that the environment-related norms are turning out to be the biggest hurdle as the land sanctioned for the project belongs to the green category. The MGM had developed Priyadarshini garden on 17-acre of green-land in question by planting and cultivating different trees in 1982.A Sena leader said not getting any interest from contractors is embarrassing. “Despite being in power at the civic body, state as well as Centre, it is kind of awkward to not get any contractor for the memorial of our party founder,” said the Shiv Sena party leader.The city of Aurangabad has traditionally remained Sena bastion. Following the death of party founder, Sena leaders pushed for an expansive memorial at 17-acre land. Though the proposal has been sanctioned by the state, but authorities in civic body claim that so far only Rs5 crore has been given that too by the then guardian minister Ramdas Kadam around a couple of years ago.The then mayor Trimbak Tupe had moved a proposal for construction of the memorial, including a 93-feet high statue of the late leader, developing the garden and also having a museum, consisting article belonging to the late Sena supremo.A contractor, requesting anonymity, maintained that they are struggling to get their bills cleared for works that have already been done months ago. “Due to this many have turned their back on this tender. Moreover, there are strict environment norms in the tender as the construction of the memorial will require chopping of tens of hundred trees,” he said.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

PM Kisan scheme to cover farmers irrespe.description: AURANGABAD: The union ministry of agriculture and farmers welfare has issued a communication relaxing the criteria of land holding for those being covered under the ambitious Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM Kisan). In the interim budget 2019-20, the central government had announced the PM Kisan scheme under which Rs6,000 per year will be given in three instalments to 12 crore small and marginal farmers holding cultivable land up to two hectare. The latest decision is set to increase the number of farmers under the scheme, manifold. In an attempt to cover majority of farmers, the ministry has asked all chief secretaries of the states and union territories to extend the purview of the scheme to all landholding farmers in the country irrespective of their size of landholding. The notification, dated June 7, said that the farmers of higher economic status shall not be eligible for benefit under the scheme. Those excluded from the scheme include all institutional land holders, farmer families having one or more people who are former and present holders of constitutional posts, former and present ministers and members of Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha, legislative assembly, council, former and present mayor, and chairperson of district panchayats. The scheme has also excluded all serving as well as retired government employees, apart from superannuated pensioners whose monthly pension is Rs10, 000 or more. In addition to this all those who paid income tax in last assessment year as well as professionals including doctors, engineers, lawyers, chartered accountants, architects registered with professional bodies and carrying out profession by undertaking practices. Acting on the same, the state also issued a communication on Thursday to all the district collectors citing the communication from the ministry of agriculture and farmers welfare. The district collectors have been asked to expedite successful implementation of the scheme. The drought-hit Marathwada region has about 42 lakh hectare of land of which about 38 lakh is cultivable land owned by around 34.82 lakh farmers. As per state agriculture department’s earlier government resolution (GR), in order to ensure filling up of a data comprising name of the beneficiary farmer, details age, sex, caste, mobile number, AADHAR card number and bank account number are being uploaded on the PM-Kisan portal. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Activists demand polls through ballot pa.description: AURANGABAD: Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh (BBM) activists, who are a part of the Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi (VBA), took to the streets on Monday and protested against the use of EVM machines during polls, demanding the election authorities opt for ballot papers instead. As a part of the protest, the political workers sat on agitation outside the district collectorate and rang bells to draw the attention of the authorities toward their demands. BRP’s state general secretary Amit Bhuigal said that the recently concluded general elections have brought several irregularities to the surface. “To ensure a transparent electoral process, we need to have all future elections through ballot papers,” said Bhuigal, who is a close aide of BBM & VBA leader Prakash Ambedkar. The VBA is currently an ally of the AIMIM in Maharashtra. The agitators alleged that the total number of votes polled from Maharashtra in the general elections are not matching with the total number of votes counted. Through a memorandum, the activists stated that soon after the elections results were declared, their party leader Prakash Ambedkar had demanded that the Election Commission of India come out with an explanation about the difference between the polled votes and the total votes counted. The agitators shouted slogans including ‘EVM Hatao, Desh Bachao’, while threatening to transform their demand in to a public movement, if polling through EVM machines is not called off for future polls. Saving water: Cops adopt villages.description: AURANGABAD: Due to severe drought, the residents of modest Kasrwadi village of Ambad tehsil in neighbouring Jalna district are forced to rely on water tankers for driking and irrigation purposes. However, they are hopeful of getting enough rain this year. Their hopes rose after the Jalna police dug a 1200 metre long trench in the river subsidiary passing from the village. With population of 1700, the village witnessed farmer suicides last year due to drought situation. The fact that the village is situated on a steep surface; it does not have any water catchment area, making it one of the most drought-prone villages in Ambad division. “The village has over 80 wells and all of them have gone dry. We have been allotted three water tankers of 12, 000 litres each, but have to sustain on two tankers, due to heavy rush at the water filter plant from where the drinking water is being sources,” Kawarwadi village sarpanch Viswambar Phulaji Kharat (50) told TOI. The initiative is part of Aurangabad range police’s first of its kind of move to adopt villages and make them water sufficient. As part of the initiative, four police units of Aurangabad rural, Jalna, Beed, and Osmanabad have been tasked to adopt at least one village and undertake initiatives including water harvesting, digging trench in existing water bodies, reviving wells, and other scientifically proven methods. Special Inspector General of Police (IGP, Aurangabad range) Ravinder Kumar Singal told TOI, “This is our small initiative in preparing the villages in beating the water scarcity, which has unfortunately become a frequent phenomenon for the region.” Seeing the policemen doing ‘Shramdan’ in the adopted villages, the residents, NGOs, and industrial houses have come forward to contribute their bit in the noble cause. As part of the plan, a series of initiatives like starting of libraries, providing books, bags and uniforms to the students, reviving the village wells, imparting skill development courses to village youths and also training the farmers in doing farming in scientific manner are on the police’s priority to-do list. IGP Singal, who is currently incharge of the Nanded range which has four districts in the drought hit Marathwada region, is all set to undertake similar initiatives in the region. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Aurangabad: Private hospitals join natio.description: AURANGABAD: Members of the Indian Medical Association (IMA), Aurangabad joined the nationwide bandh called by the parent body against the attack on a junior doctor in Kolkata a week ago. Around 500 big and small hospitals in the city remained shut in wake of the bandh on Monday. In a statement by the IMA, Aurangabad, all 1,400 doctor members of the body participated in the bandh. “515 small and big hospitals, including corporate hospitals like Apex Hospital, Dhoot Hospital, Hegdewar Hospital, Bajaj Hospital, Asian Hospital, Orion City Care Hospital, MGM Hospital and Ciigma Hospital were closed. Bodies like the Marathwada Hospitals Association, Government Medical Officers Association, NIMA and the Medical Representatives Association supported the stir. Emergency medical services were kept out of the bandh and they continued as usual, stated the release. “There is a significant rise in the number of incidents of violence on medical professionals and in hospitals. The IMA has repeatedly raised its voice against such incidents,” said the IMA’s Aurangabad president, Satyanarayan Somani. A condemnation meeting was held at the IMA Hall near Shani Mandir, which saw the presence of all senior and expert doctors including President Somani, former president Kuldeepsing Raul, secretary Yashwant Gade, Santosh Ranjalkar, Manju Sherkar and Anupam Takalkar. The doctors demanded a central act to control the repeated incidents of violence at health institutions. The IMA said that it has gathered support from the World Medical Association for this protest. The members stated that such incidents cause inconvenience to the patients as well as the hospital staff and medical professionals have to work in fear. Meanwhile, the services at the government and municipal hospitals in the city continued as usual. The Maharashtra Association of Resident Doctors (Mard) gave an ultimatum of 7 days to the government to act on its demands for the security of resident doctors. The demands include tightening of security measures in all Maharashtra medical colleges, a Central Doctor Protection Act for all resident doctors, duty rosters for residents as per court and MCI regulation, compulsory sick allowances, central residency scheme, one nation one residency, the redressal of irrational and irregular bond schemes in various states, the immediate withdrawal of any type of bridge courses, control over privatization of medical education and the long awaited and promised stipend hike, to be effective from July. While joining the pan-India movement, the junior doctors’ body had threatened to go on strike from June 24 if the above demands are not fulfilled. Damini squads asked to keep a check on h.description: AURANGABAD: With the starting of the new academic year, patrolling squads across police stations, Damini squads and she for her squads have been asked to remain vigilant to keep a check on eve-teasing and crime against girl students. Aurangabad commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad said, “The police actively initiates action in the incidents that get reported, but at the same time, we are also concerned about the number of cases that don’t get reported. We are willing to go to any extent to address this concern.” The officer said that the aim of making these squads to patrol educational institutes is to nab the suspects off-guard and catch them red-handed. The officer said that his squads have identified the areas with a high number of educational institutes as well as coaching classes, where they will ensure police presence in uniform as well as civil dress. The authorities have also planned to reach out to the educational institutes, requesting the management, staff and students to alert the police as and when they come across any incident of crime against students and women. Deputy commissioner of police (DCP) Deepali Dhate-Ghadge said, “In most of the cases, girl students do not come forward with complaints, fearing that their education will be discontinued. Considering this limitation, we have planned to voluntarily address the issue.” The authorities have appealed to girl students to reach out to the police on its toll-free number 100, control room number 0240-2240500/2326523, and WhatsApp numbers +917741022222 and +918390022222. The DCP said, “For all the complaints we receive on these numbers, the identity of the complainant is kept confidential. In the cases, where it is needed, our women cops reach out to the victims at their houses to record the complaint.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said a committee will be set up to explore the possibility of holding simultaneous Lok Sabha and assembly polls even as several opposition parties kept away from a meeting he had called to discuss the "One Nation, One Election" proposal. Defence minister Rajnath Singh said the discussions attended by 21 of the 40 parties represented in Parliament - with three more sending written submissions - saw most parties favouring the proposal even as he added that the PM said a decision will be taken by consensus. The meeting saw key absentees such as Congress, Trinamool, BSP, DMK, SP, TDP and AAP. Left parties attended the discussions, but CPM leader Sitaram Yechury said the party felt the move was "anti-federal" and did not support it and it went against accountability of governments. CPI leader D Raja said the proposal was "impractical and unconstitutional" and would need major constitutional changes. Leaders who attended the meeting included NCP leader Sharad Pawar, CPI's D Raja, Bihar chief minister and JD (U) leader Nitish Kumar, SAD leader Sukhbir Singh Badal, Odisha chief minister and BJD leader Naveen Patnaik and National People's Party leader Conrad Sangma. PDP leader Mehbooba Mufti and National Conference's Farooq Abdullah also attended the meeting. Pawar is understood to have said the proposal would take time to implement and was not a simple matter. Mehbooba and Abdullah are also understood to have pointed out problems in ensuring simultaneous assembly and Lok Sabha polls. BJP ally Shiv Sena was absent as Wednesday was the Foundation Day of the party with a function organised in Mumbai. Among important non-NDA leaders, Patnaik supported the proposal as did YSR Congress's Jaganmohan Reddy. TRS was represented by K Chandrasekhar Rao's son KT Rama Rao, who said the proposal needs more detailed examination before a decision can be arrived at. "The PM will form the committee to look into possibilities of simultaneous polls. Exact nature of the committee will be made public later," Singh told the media. He said the committee will give its suggestions on the subject in a time-bound manner and quoted the PM as saying that "One Nation, One Election" was not an agenda of any party but of the nation and that political parties should consider the larger interest of the country. Modi said all parties will be taken into confidence before taking a final decision and differences of opinion will be taken into account with full seriousness. "Most parties gave their support, CPI(M) and CPI had a difference of opinion but they didn't oppose the idea, just the implementation of it," Singh claimed. "We had invited 40 political parties, out of which 21 parties participated and three other parties sent their opinion on the subjects in writing." BSP chief Mayawati tweeted on Tuesday morning saying she would have attended the all-party meeting if it was on electronic voting machines (EVMs). Besides simultaneous polls, the PM had invited heads of political parties to discuss several issues, including celebration of 75 years of Independence in 2022 and 150th birth anniversary celebrations of Mahatma Gandhi this year. Last August, the Law Commission recommended simultaneous elections to Lok Sabha and state assemblies to save public money. The draft said, "Holding simultaneous elections is not possible within the existing framework of the Constitution." The panel recommended amendments to the Constitution and the Representation of the People Act to ensure simultaneous elections. The law panel as well as a group of senior officials set up by Modi in his first term had suggested that elections can be synchronised in two phases. The next Lok Sabha election could see states due to go to polls within six months before or after national polls brought together. The remainder states could be brought into the fold in the subsequent the Lok Sabha polls. Lack of consensus ensured the proposal never got off the ground. It now appears that Modi is using his fresh majority to give the proposal another strong push by kick-starting a discussion. \nSocialites celebrate World Water Day i.description: On the occasion of World Water Day which was on March 22, eminent personalities who worked extensively towards water conservation came together to celebrate this day. Water security, water conservation and water cooperation was the theme of this year’s celebration. Madhavrao Chitale, a water management expert, Popatrao Pawar, creator of Hiware Bazaar village, Harshdeep Kambale, city municipal commissioner and Balkrishna Bhakre among others stressed on the importance of water. “There is no source of water in 330 villages in the district. Tanker sources are also reducing day by day. In 2025, available water will be 40 % less than what we will actually require,” said Vikram Kumar, city’s district collector. Ramesh Pandav, a professor at MIT College appealed to the administration to adopt Israel’s water management technique to solve the water problem. A poster competition was also organised on this occasion. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. \nClassical music concert organised by D.description: This classical music concert organised recently by the music department of Dr Babasaheb Marathwada University was a treat for music connoisseurs in the city. Classical vocalist Pandit Vidyadhar Vyas, sitar maestro Ustad Usman Khan and sarod player Aboli Sulakhe enthralled the audience with their spectacular performances. Research papers were also presented by professors from Pune, Mumbai and Nashik during the event. Beautiful renditions presented by various musicians lifted the mood at this event. Pandit Vyas presented two bandish — Hu To Jan Man Chandiyale and Mori Nayi Lagan Lagi Re from raag Kamod. Ustad Usman Khan evoked a range of emotions by playing raag Charukeshi, while Sulakhe mesmerised the crowd with raag Kirwani. Tabla artiste Vicknesh Ramkrishnan from Malaysia, vocalist Pandit Vishwanath Oak, ghazal singer Dr Dost Mohammad Khan, vocalist Nath Niralkar, and V M Pandharipande, vice chancellor of the university, were among those present at the event. Tanker rates hit the roof owing to risin.description: AURANGABAD: Sporadic pre-monsoon showers brought some relief from the sweltering heat but did little to improve the water situation in the city. Low water levels in dams across the region, including Jayakwadi, and power shutdowns for maintenance have aggravated the problem. On Friday, the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Corporation Limited (MSEDCL) conducted a shut down for maintenance works. As a result, taps ran dry in many areas for sixth consecutive day on Saturday. Residents began calling up tankers but were told about higher than usual rates. Suwarta Dongardive, a resident of Cidco N-6, said her laundry is piling up. “We cannot afford tankers but there is no option. We earlier used to pay Rs 300-400 for 2,000 litre tanker. Now, we are being asked to pay Rs 600 to private supplier,” she said. Every alternate house in Gulmohar Colony Cidco N-5 has to shell out money to purchase private tankers. In Nandanwan Colony, if one needs a tanker, they have to book a day in advance. Santosh Bhujbal, a tanker supplier, said his family well has dried up and he has to pay the owner of another well for pumping water. “We have to pay the owner Rs 200-250 and then add the transportation cost. This is the reason the prices have surged,” Bhujbal said. Cidco based SK suppliers said most local well have dried up, forcing them to fetch water from a well near the railway station. In April, the AMC had sought a report from its deputy engineers on the number of public and private wells in their zones with an intent to acquire them following district collector’s permission. When asked about the acquisition of wells, municipal commissioner Nipun Vinayak said a list of acquired wells is shared with the deputy engineers for testing of water and starting the distribution. “It appears that water from many wells is unfit for drinking due to E coli,” he said. Vinayak added that no regulation for the quality or price of private water suppliers is in place but he would prepare bylaws for the regulation and submit it in the forthcoming general body meeting. Jaideep Zalte of the Congress said the tanker lobby in city started growing in the 1990s. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Uttar Pradesh.description: "You're sitting on my grand mother's grave," Salim Shah told this correspondent. She has been buried, he said, in his living room. A clutch of houses in Chah Pokhar in Achnera block of Agra have turned into graveyards as families are forced to bury their departed in their homes due to lack of a burial ground. As a result, the dead here are a constant part of day-to-day life. TOI found women cooking next to where their children were buried while the elderly rested on cots in a backyard full of graves. In one of the houses, Rinki Begum told TOI that five bodies were buried in her backyard, including that of her 10-month-old son who had died of an untreated fever. Another resident, Guddi, said, "For poor people like us, there is no dignity in death. Due to lack of space in houses, people have to sit and walk over graves. It is so disrespectful." Almost all the houses in the block have graves within the compound Most of the Muslim families here are poor and landless and men scout for work as contract labourers. They said their demand for a graveyard has been ignored for years. The pond in Chah Pokhar village, where a piece of land is allocated for the burial ground on papersThe apathy of the administration can be gauged from the fact that a plot allotted for a graveyard some years ago falls right in the middle of a pond. Repeated complaints have fallen on deaf ears and residents are running out of space. The fresh graves are no more cemented to ensure they occupy less space and stones of different sizes kept over them are the only way to tell them apart. Protests have erupted in the past over the issue. In 2017, after the death of resident Mangal Khan, his family refused to bury his body until land for a graveyard was provided in the village. After assurances by the authorities, they buried Khan near the pond. But the promises came to nothing. Living with the dead: A grave in the backyard"All we are asking for is some land for our ancestors. There is a cremation ground for the Hindus in the periphery of the village, but we are living with our dead," said Munim Khan, a factory worker. Desperate residents even tried reaching out to nearby Sanan village and Achnera town that have burial grounds. But they were not willing to part with precious space. "These two villages have a larger Muslim population than Chah Pokhar. Their burial grounds are filled to capacity," said Nizam Khan, a mechanic. Village pradhan Sundar Kumar said that he had asked officials several times for a burial ground for Muslim families, but no action was taken. Ravi Kumar NG, the district magistrate, said that he was not aware of the issue. "I will send an official team to the village and get details of the burial land required." Picture Credit: Hemant Kumar In Video:Houses turn into graveyards as Muslims in this UP village bury the dead at homeDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Sports university in Aurangabad gets a p.description: AURANGABAD: The additional budget presented by the state government on Tuesday for 2019-20 has commitments of building an international sports complex at Waluj and push for the pending project of setting up a dedicated sports university in Aurangabad. While no specific budgetary allocations have been made for these two projects, the desired fund flow is expected in due course of time as both the ventures have official mention in the state budget. Among different specific allocations related to the region, finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar has earmarked funds worth Rs50crore for the development of pilgrim and tourist site of Kapildhara in Beed district along with five other similar sites across the state. A section of public representatives was demanding a state-of-the-art sports complex at Waluj following which a search for around 65-acre land had begun. First announced by the higher and technical education minister Rajesh Tope in 2013, the city has been waiting eagerly for the sports university. A demand was also raised before the state legislature, responding to which state minister Vinod Tawde had said that the desired facility will be raised at Karodi on the outskirts of Aurangabad. Notably, the newly-appointed state sports commissioner Om Prakash Bakoria has brought some momentum towards establishment of the long-pending National Sports University sanctioned in Aurangabad. The additional budget also has a mention of proposed multi-crore water grid project for Marathwada, but no specific budgetary allocation has been made. State water supply minister Babanrao Lonikar recently said the detailed project report (DPR) for the water grid was ready and actual work on the project during the first phase would begin before the upcoming Assembly elections in the state. Located around 15-km from Beed, Kapildhara has a few waterfalls and is a popular tourist destination during monsoon. Manmathswami shrine is also located here and it draws large number of devotees on the occasion of annual fair held during the second half of the year. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. MGM hospital to get a modern ICU.description: AURANGABAD: Mahatma Gandhi Mission (MGM) Hospital is all set to get a modern modular intensive care unit (ICU) from Saturday. The charitable hospital already has nine ICUs and the one unveiled on Saturday would be the 10th ICU of the hospital. Pravin Suryawanshi, deputy dean at MGM Medical College and Hospital (MGMMCH) said, “The 11-bed ICU aims at providing state of the art care for patients in Aurangabad so that they don’t have to go to other cities for critical care treatment.” MGMMCH dean Rajendra Bohra said that the ICU infection control system will save expenses of the patient. “The cardiac output monitor at the ICU can help diagnose what is causing the BP to rise or fall which will help in treatment and early recovery,” Bohra said. The MGM’s Medical Centre and Research Institute (MCRI) ICU facilitates also has ventilators and monitor for each of the 11 beds. It also has a signaling system that prevents people from entering into the patient cabin without cleaning their hand with a sanitizer installed outside the room. The other equipment available at the unit includes dialysis machine, sonography machine and X-ray machine. Anand Nikalje, director ICU unit said that the unit ensures a thorough check on hospital acquired infections due to its built-in mechanisms. One can only enter the unit after the operator shows an access card to the sensor. It has a negative pressure room for quarantine patients suffering with diseases like swine flu which prevents their infection from spreading to other patients. The unit also has a positive pressure room for patients with compromised immune systems in which air flows out of the room instead of coming in. It helps prevent any airborne microorganisms to reach the patient. The ICU will be inaugurated on Saturday by MGM Trust secretary Ankushrao Kadam and a workshop for disease management in ICU will be held for doctors in Marathwada on June 15 at the hospital. Aurangabad: Faulty kidney removed via tr.description: AURANGABAD: A team of doctors in a city based hospital removed an infected kidney from a woman through trans-vaginal route. The procedure was carried out through laparoscopy. On June 1, a 35-year-old woman visited the Kamalnayan Bajaj Hospital complaining of abdominal pain, fever, and vomiting. She was diagnosed with left pynoephrosis (pus filled kidney) non-functioning left kidney. Subsequently, the doctors decided to perform a surgery and remove her left kidney. Urologist Aditya Yelikar said that if the kidney would not have been removed, the patient could have slipped into sepsis, endangering her life. "The nuclear scan reported the functioning of the kidney as zero percent," he said. The kidney could have either been removed through open surgery or minimally invasive method (laparoscopy). An open surgery tends to leave scars, causes pain, and takes longer time to heal. Therefore, the doctors decided to go ahead with the laparoscopy surgery which requires a minor incision. The surgery was conducted after taking the patient's and her kin's consent. After explaining everything about the surgery to the patient and her kin, the doctors decided to remove the infected kidney through the vagina so as to ensure that there are no scars and cuts. Yelikar undertook the procedure called nephrectomy with trans-vaginal retrieval of specimen. This procedure ensures early recovery and the patient is discharged within 48 hours. "As the kidney is as big as 10 cm the usual laparoscopy could have caused a much bigger incision. Therefore, the organ was removed through vagina. A single stich had been made in the process which from the inside and from the outside one cannot tell if she underwent nephrectomy," the urologist said. The surgical team included anaesthesiologist Sanjeev Purohit, OT staff Sahebrao Jadhav, Wilson Jadhav and Maya Sable. The woman had visited the hospital for a follow-up on Monday and did not have any pain or uneasiness, Yelikar said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ramdas Athawale.description: NEW DELHI: Union minister and Republican Party of India leader Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday left members of the Lok Sabha, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in peels of laughter with his witty remarks, some aimed at Congress president Rahul Gandhi. In his congratulatory remarks after the unanimous election of Om Birla as Lok Sabha Speaker, Athawale, who has a knack for spontaneous humour, said he is happy that Rahul got a chance to sit in Lok Sabha though as an opposition member. While Rahul won from Wayanad in Kerala, he lost the Gandhi stronghold of Amethi in Uttar Pradesh to Smriti Irani. #WATCH:Ramdas Athawale in Lok Sabha says,"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon… https://t.co/cRPL9IbuWV— ANI (@ANI) 1560939466000"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon. Jab apki satta thi tab main aapke saath tha. Chunav ke pehle mujhe Congress wale bol rahe the idhar aao. Maine hawa ka rukh dekha ki woh Modi ji ki taraf ja rahi hai (I congratulate you on getting an opportunity to sit there (in the Opposition benches). I was with the UPA when it was in power. Congress leaders asked me to join them again ahead of elections. But I saw which way the wind was blowing and decided to remain with NDA," he said. Rahul and Sonia took his remarks sportingly and were seen smiling. When the RPI leader was speaking, Modi was seen laughing on more than two occasions. "Now, our government will run for five years, and for another five years ... Modi sahib will continue to do the good work. We will not let you come this side (treasury benches) so easily," Athawale said, amid thumping of desks by NDA members. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Two trains cancelled till September.description: AURANGABAD: The Nizamabad-Pune-Nizamabad and Pandharpur-Nizamabad-Pandharpur passenger trains will not be plying till the end of September — barring a period of one week falling around Ashadhi Ekadashi celebration. “The major disruption in the popular train services has been announced in the wake of a traffic block to be undertaken by the Central Railway in Solapur division,” an official release said. Accordingly, the Nizamabad-Pune passenger train (No. 51422) is slated to remain off-track with immediate effect till July 5 and later between July 15 and September 25. The passenger train (No. 51421) in the return direction (Pune-Nizamabad) will not be pressed into service with immediate effect till July 6 and later from July 15 to September 26. The Pandharpur-Nizamabad passenger train (No. 51434) remains cancelled with immediate effect till July 5 and later between July 15 and September 25. In the return direction, the train (No.51433) will not be pressed into the service with immediate effect till July 7 and later between July 16 and September 27. As per official release, the Nizamabad-Pune passenger train has been short-terminated at Daund with immediate effect till July 14. Nanded-Daund-Nanded passenger is another train that will be partially affected due to the aforesaid traffic block in Solapur division. Accordingly, Nanded-Daund passenger train (No. 57516) will be short-terminated at Kopargaon with immediate effect till July 5 and later for a period between July 15 and September 25. \nNational Moot Court Competition at the.description: The recently concluded National Moot Court Competition at the Manikchand Pahade Law College witnessed loads of participation and talent. Law students from colleges across India presented hypothetical cases that raised questions about rights of freedom of speech and expression, corruption and government’s responsibility to maintain law and order in the country. Out of 17 teams who participated in the preliminary round, six teams including the Manikchand Pahade Law College, Aurangabad, qualified for the final round. The final round was evaluated by eminent judges Justice PV Hardas of Bombay High Court and Justice VV Afzalpurkar of Andhra Pradesh High Court. Students of Indian Law Society’s Law College (ILS), Pune emerged winners while Law Center, Delhi University achieved the second position. Ankita Brigit from School Of Law, Christ University, Bangalore won the Late Advocate SA Deshmukh Best Mooter trophy, Priyanka Joshi from ILS Law College, Pune won the First Best Speaker Award and Shreya Paturi from the same college won Second Best Speaker Award. Advising the students Justice Hardas said, “Law students do not spend much time attending courts. They should attend the hearings in court to learn how advocates interact with judges as well to learn courtroom proceedings.” PV Mandlik, Anjali Bajpei-Dube, VD Salunke, SM Godse, NK Kakde, Ravi Ghuge, MV Deshpande, SS Deshmukh, NK Khandare, Dr CM Rao, Dr Aparna Kotapalle, Bhagyashri Godbole and SD Deshpande were some professionals who attended the competition. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Aurangabad: Citizens left high and dry a.description: AURANGABAD: The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Corporation Ltd (MSEDCL) on Friday undertook maintenance shutdown at its feeders supplying power to Cidco, Hudco, Chikalthana and Kranti Chowk areas. The power outage not only left the residents sweating, but also led to disruption in water supply in many areas. MIDC Chikalthana industries also remained shut due to power disruption. According to a release by the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC), due to power outage at Jayakwadi, from 8.30am to 9.40am on Saturday, water could not be lifted at 56MLD and 100MLD pumping stations during that time. Pumping could start at 10.30am from Jayakwadi. This had a domino effect on water pumping station at Pharola, where pumping normalised at 12.30pm. Water works department executive engineer Hemant Kolhe said that it takes around 6 to 8 hours for water to reach the ESRs in the city from Pharola. In addition, as part of its routine pre-monsoon maintenance, the MSEDCL undertook power shutdowns at its feeders supplying power to elevated storage reservoirs (ESRs) at Kranti Chowk, Cidco N-5 and Cidco N-7 from 10.15am to 3.15pm. Subsequently, water supply from these ESRs was affected. Water distribution resumed at 5pm. Tanker supply remained affected throughout Friday in the affected ESRs. Residents from lane number 12 of Jai Bhawani Nagar, who came to Cidco N-5 ESR, said that they had paid for tanker water three months in advance. “The AMC charges Rs1,100 for 200-litre water on alternate days for three months. Today is the fifth day that we have not received any water. Nine of us paid Rs30 each to come to ESR tanker but they flatly refused supply,” Sunita Shinde, a resident, said. Officials at the AMC water works department said that power shutdown at Jayakwadi on Saturday will affect water supply for two days. The supply will normalise only after two days, they said. Meanwhile, production at industries in Chikalthana MIDC had to bear the impact of MSEDCL’s scheduled shutdown. MSEDCL urban superintending engineer B Nirmal said that the maintenance will help reduce frequent power outages faced by the units in the industrial estate. Aurangabad police to scan criminals posi.description: AURANGABAD: To ensure that criminals do not shield themselves under the garb of industrial labourers, the Aurangabad city police are planning to scan the criminal records of daily wage labourers as well as those employed with the industrial houses. The fact is that the industrial houses usually go slow during he summers due to water scarcity and start returning to normalcy with the onset of monsoon, which eventually increases the demand for labourers, skilled as well as unskilled. Taking advantage of the high absorption rate of daily wage labourers in Aurangabad’s industrial areas of MIDC Waluj, Shendra and to some extent in the Chikalthana area, several labourers from different parts of the country come here and get employment. Police authorities maintained that it is part of the preventive measures being taken by the city police for keeping a check on criminals. Aurangabad commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad said, “We do not appreciate people getting hired or being given houses and flats on rent sans police verification. It is serious if those with criminal backgrounds are hiding in the city and working as labourers.” The officer maintained that the police are concerned with labourers with criminal records as the presence of such elements help fuel illegal activities and criminal conduct. The police maintained that not only labourers, but also several labour and security contractors, are getting absorbed sans police verifications and are working without any license or authenticity in different industrial areas of the city. In the past. there have been incidents where the police has found that criminals elements, in an attempt to evade arrest, are working as labourers in the industrial areas of Aurangabad by using a fake identity. Sources in the police department said that even during the industrial violence of August 9, 2017, mobs that were later termed as ‘motivated crowd’, comprising locals and outsiders alike, targeted major industrial houses, causing losses amounting to several crores. Police authorities are also considering labourers with criminal records as the link between the manufacturers of country-made firearms and local purchasers. \nMarathi actress Pooja Sawant performs.description: This fashion event held in the city on Thursday was full of glam and style. Models were seen sashaying down the ramp donning traditional Indian wear. Dancers kept the audience entertained with their rocking performances in between the modelling sessions. Marathi actress Pooja Sawant who had been invited specially for the event, surprised everyone with her lavani performance. We spotted Sanjay Kumar, commissioner of police, having a good time on the occasion. Some prominent Aurangabadkars present were Sanjay Shirsath and Dhananjay Dalal. Aurangabad: Puddle on road leads to assa.description: AURANGABAD: Six people, including two minors, were booked for allegedly rioting and assaulting a man who had asked one of their friends to ride his two-wheeler slowly after the motorcyclist splashed muddy water on the pedestrians passing by in the Jadhavwadi area. Dhanaji Chavan (25), a resident of Jadhavwadi area, was standing near a roadside shop on Monday evening when a speeding bike, that was passing by, splashed water that had accumulated in a puddle. Chavan instantly asked the youth driving the motorcycle to drive slowly. This did not go down well with the youth who got into an altercation with Chavan. The suspect was soon joined by his friends who started assaulting him. Chavan somehow managed escape and reached Cidco police station to lodge a complaint. The accused were booked on the charges of unlawful assembly, rioting, voluntarily causing hurt and criminal intimidation. When contacted, Cidco police said that of the six suspects named in the complaint, two were minors who have been let off for the time being. Efforts were on to arrest the remaining four suspects. Residents in the area blamed the poor condition of the road for the incident. . Lala Khan, a resident of the area said, “Due to the abominable state of the roads, even mild showers result in water logging in the area, making movement of pedestrians difficult.” Other residents claimed that several pleas to the area corporator as well as authorities of the civic administration have been an excercise in futility. “Due to bad roads, commoners are suffering from neck and back pain. Even their vehicles need frequent maintenance. But riot offences getting registered over stagnant water getting splashed on pedestrians is a new low,” said Mukund Deshmukh, another resident of the area. Aurangabad celebrated Eid-ul-Fitr amidst.description: After a month of fasting, the city soaked itself in the fervour of Eid-ul-Fitr recently. While thousands of believers offered prayers at the beautifully decked up mosques and idgahs of Aurangabad, friends and family exchanged greetings and gifts along with warm embraces and grand feasts. While visting mosques and idgahs, they greeted each other as they dressed up in new clothes. Aurangabadkars were also seen clicking selfies as they celebrated the festival with joy and happiness. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. FDA, crime branch seize gutka worth Rs38.description: AURANGABAD: The food and drug administration (FDA) officials along with the crime branch of city police laid a trap at Karudi Shivar on Nagpur-Mumbai highway and seized two vehicles carrying gutka. In all as many as 243 bags of gutka worth Rs38 lakh were seized from the vehicles — a pick-up van and a mini-truck. Based on the complaint lodged by an FDA official, an offence was registered against the three occupants of the vehicles at Daulatabad police station in the wee hours of Friday. The accused have been identified Rubab Ali Hazrat Ali Shaikh (27) and Indresh Shrimadanlal Nishad (28), both hailing from Uttar Pradesh UP, and Tausif Samad Shaikh (20) of Sajapur. Police are yet to ascertain the source of the banned stuff. FDA assistant commissioner MD Shah, who was also part of the team that made the seizure, said the action was a result of intelligence worked upon for several days. Crime branch team led by police sub-inspector Afroz Shaikh along with FDA officials nabbed the accused when the banned substance was being loaded from the mini-truck into the pickup van. Crime branch inspector Madhukar Sawant, citing directives of the commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad, said the action is part of the city police’s all-out drive against all illicit businesses in the limits of the city. Police have also slapped section 328 (causing hurt by means of poisonous substance) of the Indian Penal Code — a cognizable offence triable by sessions court. A couple of days ago, the City Chowk police launched a crackdown against small gutka traders and arrested eight paan stall owners. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tears, cackles as schools offer rousing.description: AURANGABAD: Amid a delayed monsoon, the schools affiliated with the Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education (MSBSHE) re-opened after the summer vacation, on Monday. Mixed scenes were witnessed outside the school gates with a section of students, especially first-time school goers, were all in tears while stepping into the campuses, while many others bid adieu to their parents on a happy note. Local book-shops and markets selling items such as school bags, water bottles and rain gear also witnessed heavy rush with students and parents ensuring adequate preparations to welcome the new academic year. Besides the aided and unaided educational institutions, schools associated with the Zilla Parishad (ZP) also re-opened in Marathwada. In keeping with the recent trend, schools gave a rousing welcome to the new students and their parents by offering roses and sweets. Some ZP-run schools also arranged for special processions in villages to mark the beginning of the academic year 2019-20. Pravin Muley, a graduate teacher from a ZP-run school in the Badnapur taluka of Jalna district, said that new students and their parents were felicitated as part of a welcoming ceremony of students. “The schools are reopening in the shadow of drought as the onset of Monsoon has been delayed. As far as our school is concerned, the necessary availability of water exists as of now,” he said. Notably, the State School Education Department has already asked the Education Commissioner and the Director-level authorities to ensure sufficient water for drinking and other needs in schools after reopening. The top brass of the education department has specifically asked for according the highest priority to ensuring the availability of water in schools run by ZPs in drought and other affected areas. Education officer (Primary) with Aurangabad ZP, S P Jaiswal on Saturday said that Block Education Officers (BEOs) have been told to report on the water availability situation in their areas. Aurangabad district alone has nearly 2,046 schools run by the ZP and school authorities have been told to ensure that no dearth of water for drinking purposes and other needs arise as the academic session begins. Meanwhile, a large section of city-based schools affiliated with the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) also commenced their new academic year during the last week. Monika Sakhare, a parent of a Class III student, said that she had to spent some hours doing the necessary shopping for her son before the start of the new academic session. “The schooling has undergone a sea change as compared to our school days and we have to support the students right from day one,” she said. Posters exhibition at GMCH.description: AURANGABAD: The geriatrics department of the Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) and District Civil Hospital, Chikalthana, held a poster exhibition to mark World Elder Abuse Awareness Day. The exhibition was inaugurated by GMCH dean Kanan Yelikar at the OPD building around 10am on Monday. The posters were aimed at raising awareness about abuse and mistreatment of the elderly. During the inaugural function, patients and their relatives visiting the hospital were sensitised about elder abuse. Psychiatrist at the public health department Amit Tak spoke about the various forms of abuse. GMCH medical superintendent Zine gave details about the facilities available for elderly people in the state-run hospital including free OPD registration, free investigation and a separate counter for elderly patients at each service window.
